greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k such that the k-th cyclotomic polynomial has -n as a coefficient.
comment: Suzuki proves that a(n) exists for each n.
link: Jiro Suzuki, On coefficients of cyclotomic polynomials, Proc. Japan Acad. Ser. A Math. Sci. 63:7 (1987), pp. 279-280.
R. C. Vaughan, Bounds for the coefficients of cyclotomic polynomials, Michigan Math. J. 21 (1974), 289-295 (1975).
example: Phi(105) = x^48 + x^47 + x^46 - x^43 - x^42 - 2x^41 - x^40 - x^39 + x^36 + x^35 + x^34 + x^33 + x^32 + x^31 - x^28 - x^26 - x^24 - x^22 - x^20 + x^17 + x^16 + x^15 + x^14 + x^13 + x^12 - x^9 - x^8 - 2x^7 - x^6 - x^5 + x^2 + x + 1, with -2 as the coefficient of x^7 (among others), and this is the least k for which -2 appears, so a(2) = 105.
mathematica: Table[k = 1; While[! MemberQ[CoefficientList[Cyclotomic[k, x], x], -n], k++]; k, {n, 0, 9}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 29 2015 *)
results.author: _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 21 2015
